docs.lead_paragraph: King Solomon’s choice was easy compared with  the one faced by the North Carolina judge Nancy E. Gordon. The custody dispute before her recently was between Alaina Giordano and her ex-husband, Kane Snyder, and the fight was over whether their children — 11-year-old Sofia and 5-year-old Bud — should live with their mother, in Durham, or their father, in Chicago.

headline.main: Losing Custody Because She Has Cancer

docs.abstract: A North Carolina woman is ordered to send her children to their father in Chicago because a judge fears she will become too ill to care for them.
docs.snippet: A North Carolina woman is ordered to send her children to their father in Chicago because a judge fears she will become too ill to care for them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Is Mitt Romney, the former Republican governor of Massachusetts, an advocate for a state version of what conservatives derisively call Obamacare?
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney knows he has to find a way to reconcile his championing of universal health care in Massachusetts with his opposition to President Obama's health care law.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney knows he has to find a way to reconcile his championing of universal health care in Massachusetts with his opposition to President Obama's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: An excerpt from a memoir by the daughter of a compulsive hoarder.
docs.snippet: An excerpt from a memoir by the daughter of a compulsive hoarder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lori Eiler-Hunter was a dynamo, a leader, a force. She was the kind of woman who left instructions for her obituary: “In lieu of flowers Lori requested that you read to your children, call your mother, say please and thank you and mind your P’s and Q’s.” When her brain cancer was first diagnosed six years ago, she made it clear she planned to fight hard to hang in for her husband, Art, and their then middle-school-aged children. Statistics said she should never have had those six years, but Lori used them to see Max and Alexandra both get settled into life at college.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yes, it's true, Republican House freshmen say, our party did help storm town-hall-style meetings to protest changes in the Medicare plan during the debate over the health care overhaul. But they would appreciate it if Democrats did not take that page from their playbook.

headline.main: Republicans Decry Tactics the Party Used in 2009

docs.abstract: Republican freshmen in the House want Democrats to stop the "political rhetoric" when it comes to their proposal on Medicare -- even while admitting that their party took similar liberties during the health care debate.
